events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle on May 14, 2024. Initial details were provided promptly.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident following the identification of keywords related to vehicle collision and damages reported.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the car accident claim and initiate communication with the claimant and other involved parties.
The claimant received formal acknowledgement from the insurer that the auto accident claim is being processed and their case is now active.
The insurer requested documentation including police reports, vehicle registration, photos of the accident damage, and repair estimates.
The claimant submitted all requested documents related to the car accident promptly, including photos and police accident report.
The insurance company began an investigation to verify collision details, liability, and extent of damage to the claimant’s vehicle.
Investigation concluded confirming the insured’s vehicle was damaged in a collision caused by another driver running a red light.
A settlement proposal was sent to the claimant, outlining the approved amount to cover repairs and related expenses from the accident.
The claimant responded expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement offer and timely communications by the insurance agent.
The claim was officially approved for the settlement amount after final review and acceptance of all terms by the claimant.
The insurance payment was issued electronically to the claimant’s bank account to cover the cost of vehicle repairs.
Following successful payment and claimant confirmation, the auto accident claim was officially closed in the system.
The case file and all associated claim documents were archived for record-keeping and future reference as per policy.
